catalog_description: Provides students understanding of data analytics lifecycle, decision-making frameworks, and tools. Covers data curation, quantitative analysis, exploratory/predictive modeling with case-based and hands-on analytics toolkit approach using Tableau and Python.
learning_objectives: Define and apply a Business Data Analytics Life Cycle perspective to business problems
Understand organizational considerations in data-driven decision-making
Understand how organizations plan for and govern data analytics efforts
Develop familiarity with data visualization tools (Tableau)
Gain understanding of how managers use business analytics to formulate and solve problems
Create and apply basic data analytic models for different decision contexts
Learn techniques like multivariate regression, logistic regression, decision trees, k-Nearest Neighbor, Naïve Bayes, k-means clustering, text mining, and sentiment analysis
Understand the suitability of different techniques for different business contexts

topics.topic: Business Intelligence and Analytics Life Cycle

assessments.description: Brief 3-minute presentation on data science/analytics theme from current news or case study
Written assignments (1.5 page max) due at start of class
Individual/multiple-choice quiz covering algorithmic techniques (October-early November)
Idea, technique, outcome, Tableau dashboard, Python code, presentation

textbooks: HBS Coursepack: BADM 557 - Business Intelligence - Spring 2025 - RS
Doing Data Science: Straight Talk from the Frontline by Rachel Schutt and Cathy O'Neill
Introduction to Machine Learning with Python by Andreas C. Müller and Sarah Guido
Understanding Generative AI Business Applications by Irena Cronin
course_format: Case-based discussion (1/3), hands-on data visualization tools (1/3), Python programming and data science libraries (1/3)
notes: Weekend course (1 session per week), discussion-based with readings required before class, project-heavy with Tableau and Python components
